channel.title: Posts on Esh's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Esh's Blog

item.title: Jupyter Lab, a note taking IDE
item.description: After a few months of switching between my virtual notebook and my IDE, I stumbled upon a new, innovative solution; Jupyter Lab Project Jupyter itself was born out of the IPython project, quickly gaining a reputation for 100% free and opensource high quality projects, one of which is Jupyter Lab Jupyter Lab, in the words of the Jupyter Project themselves, is a “Web-based flexible interactive development environment for Jupyter notebooks, code, and data with support for extensions.

item.title: Minecraft Server on Docker guide
item.description: This guide NOT for beginners. You might need to read freeCodeCamp.org’s Docker for dummies Step 1: Install Docker This will depend on platform/os but most people (e.g running some form of linux on an x64 cpu) should be able to run the code below. (Note you do need to ) curl -fsSL https://get.docker.com -o get-docker.sh   sh get-docker.sh Step 2: Run hello-world on docker to see if Docker is functional Now that we have Docker installed, we need to see if its functional so that it can succsessfully run our minecraft server.

item.title: Site rewrite complete!
item.description: The site rewrite is complete! It went through many phases of being writting in various different languages. It first started of in ReactJS, then Angular, then ReactJS, and finally Hugo. Its been an absolute blast learning Javascript and Sass to make a professional-esque blog site. Thanks to Hugo and Github Pages for making anyone be able to make a free, high quality, secure, and open-source website.

item.title: First Post
item.description: This is my first post. I’m currently going to use this blog for some Front-End dev things/Minecraft dev things. Its currently written in html/css but I’m planing to rewrite it using a static site generator (SSG) called Hugo. Once that’s complete I’ll probably start writing actual blog posts.
